website_summaries.verdict: Though it has similar features to other LIFX smart LED bulbs (including numerous colors), there are some connection issues.
pros: Offers bright light and many colors that are similar to other models
cons: Doesn't connect to some wireless networks
Some users find that after updates to the app, the connection is less reliable

website_summaries.verdict: Though it's great when it works, there are reported concerns with connection issues that interfere with its effectiveness.
pros: Gets good marks for being versatile and straightforward to use – it doesn't require a hub, works with Alexa, and is easy to set up
Users are also impressed with the bright light it emits, and beautiful multi-color options
cons: Its tendency to frequently drop connection is disappointing to many owners who love its otherwise user-friendly operation
The base tends to get hot

customer_reviews.title: the color options are a cool feature, but needing to power cycle them multiple ...
customer_reviews.text: Neat idea, the color options are a cool feature, but needing to power cycle them multiple times a day defeats the purpose. I have tp-link and lifx and the tp-link are FAR more stable. For 60 bucks a pop, these should work flawlessly. Too bad they suck. Contacted tech support, they gave me a laundry list of things to try as if I want to set up an independent network just for my lightbulbs. Network congestion: not my problem, make your product work before releasing it and charging 10x the cost of a regular led bulb.
customer_reviews.author: archeress6

customer_reviews.title: My bulbs are malfunctioning
customer_reviews.text: Bought LIFX bulb three times during 2018. As of now they are all beginning to fail. Despite multiple reinstallations they consistently disconnect from the cloud and fail to maintain Alexa control. LIFX recently “updated” the LIFX control app. According to the overwhelming number of negative reviews of this app I am not the only user having troubles similar to mine. I’m wondering if the problems are the result of very poor bulb control (by the new app) or the bulbs themselves. An integration failure perhaps? In any case I’ve chosen to give these expensive “smart” bulbs one star ratings. These bulbs retail for $60 per unit so I think they should at least function properly and consistently.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Holcomb

customer_reviews.title: Great bulb, horrible app & connectivity
customer_reviews.text: Bought this light in October 2019. Worked great for a few months, super bright and vivid colors. Then a couple weeks ago I updated the app, and the bulb no longer connects to my wifi. Just like that. Now I have a $50 piece of junk hanging off my ceiling. That's what happens when a company tries to be "new" and "trendy" with their software and stuff...they just end up breaking things that were fine to begin with. Adios, LIFX!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Good build quality.  Unreliable Wi-Fi.  Wouldn't buy them again.
customer_reviews.text: I like the build quality. They have been solid from that perspective. But the wi-fi connection is unreliable. All bulbs have the latest firmware. They report good signal strength (when the wi-fi is working). But for some reason, they fall off the network. It has been several months and I can't figure out a failure pattern (e.g. at night when neighborhood wi-fi is busy, etc.). Nope. They just go away at random. I wouldn't buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Jolla

customer_reviews.title: The best hands down.
customer_reviews.text: Great light.Tons of options.It did take 23 minutes to update firmware in the bulb after it connected to my network.Also be sure to update the app firmware as well.After all that it works great.Has lots of modes like: candle flicker,spooky mode,relax mode,2500k warm white up to 9000k blue white.Well worth the money.Plus you do not need to buy a seperate hub.
customer_reviews.author: James Yarbrough

customer_reviews.title: Avoid it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 bulbs three month ago. One of bulbs has issue - frequently loosing wifi connection. Second was ok with that, but yesterday died blue color. Do not waste your money. -- edit: blue light didn't die, just software issue. Second bulb now loosing connection even more frequent than another plus randomly changing colors over time... -- Update. Got firmware update. Sometimes lights reacts with 0.5 sec delay, but now they works stable and without any other issues. -- Update. When bulbs works stable now, they has issues with colors any way. No green color at on bulb or no blue at second? This is it. And there is no new firmware updates.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Huge improvement over Philips and GE systems
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these bulbs! I had the Philips Hue system and really didn't care for it. The Philips lights were super dim, had a hub that had to remain connected to your router via Ethernet, and the control interface was clunky. The Lifx system is the complete opposite. The bulbs are way brighter than any of the other smart bulb systems out there, there's no stupid hub, and the interface is clean and intuitive. The bulbs are fairly large and flat so if a traditional incandescent bulb shape is critical to you, these might not work. Otherwise, they totally lord over every one else's smart bulb products.
customer_reviews.author: Tysonius Maximus

customer_reviews.title: Love them.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these bulbs because they were cheaper than the Phillips Hue bulbs. Also picked them for the higher output lumens. 1000 lumens is very nice. It's equivalent to a 75w incandescent bulb I belive. I have them in a fixture and wanted a little more output because of a darker shade. They are very nice. The lifx app is very simple to use and has nice features. Will be buying more of these bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Jason & Jodi Merkel

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful colors amazing lighting!
customer_reviews.text: Ill admit it; before buying one of these lights, I must have tried 5 different brands, before biting the bullet and deciding to buy a more expensive one. It was a toss up between Lifx and the other major competitor, and after reviews decided to try a Lifx bulb. So glad I did! It gave me so much more saturation with the colors, as well as amazing ambience. Setup was simple, and took maybe 5 minutes; if even that. I am so satisfied with this purchase, that I went ahead and bought more! If you are on the fence about this light, I suggest you go ahead and get it! Youll be so happy that you did!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Warbux

customer_reviews.title: Really cool lights. Very responsive and bright.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure what to expect because there are quite a few mixed reviews but I was pleasantly surprised by these lights. They are bright and responsive and all connected to my networking without any trouble. They work great and have cool features. There are other things that would be cool to have them do but their functionality is certainly well worth the price. Really happy with them so far!
customer_reviews.author: John Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Brightest and richest color or any smart light out now!
customer_reviews.text: The picture is ONE bulb inn an alcove behind a wall sconce fixture, I FILLS the whole room with color day or night. I have just about every brand off smart color light on the market,and if i bought another it'd be one if these. It doesn't require a hub an only uses wifi, so setup can. E a bit confusing, but they have tons of tutotmruals. It easily fit right in with my home SMartthings Hub. HUE lights have aremound 750 lumens, these have 1100. These are worth the buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jason S.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: This light worked well for a year until I switched routers. I can't reconnect no matter how many times I've followed their steps BUT HERE"S THE KICKER.... they do NOT HAVE A CUSTOMER SERVICE PHONE NUMBER OR CHAT. They do everything through email and it took them weeks to respond to my email. After explaining the issue in detail they suggested all the steps I've already taken dozen of times. So frustrating I've pulled out half my hair. LIFX CUSTOMER SERVICE SUCKS
customer_reviews.author: AAFP/S

customer_reviews.title: Not good at all.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for living room lamps several months ago. The first 6 months they would occasionally drop off the wifi. Now the past couple of months I am back to turning them on and off by hand. I tried resetting them, re starting my wi fi. Deleting the app from my phone and restarting the app. Nothing worked. I finally got a response from lifx and they gave me this long laundry list of things to do. I am not that computer litterate and its become more a pain to use them. I am going to get rid of them and find another brand. Anything is better than these. Save your money and buy a different make.
customer_reviews.author: James V. Sharkey

customer_reviews.title: Don't work (UPDATE: Now they do)
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: There was an update to the app and I tried to connect them and now they work without a problem. Shame it took 5 months but, I'm just glad they do. Well, I bought two and they work in that they light up but, that's it. I have tried everything available to try since November 2019 and try again whenever there's an update to the app and nothing changes. They will connect to the app but the setup always quits and says, 'Let's try again'. I guess I wouldn't recommend it to anyone with a Sony phone since it seems to work for others.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin O. Otieno

customer_reviews.title: I wish it could last longer...
customer_reviews.text: I have my whole apartment set up for it and so far each of my original purchase are dying within 2-3 years. Not sure how to feel about it. I feel like for the price of one bulb, I would still be under the normal cost of regular light bulbs for the entire apt. Also unless it exponentially loses efficacy the longer you have it on. I should still at most 4.5 years for having it on 24/7, of which I did not. Sigh....
customer_reviews.author: Plumber

customer_reviews.title: Best colored bulbs out there!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried MANY of the cheaper bulbs on the market. You either need another hub device added to your network, the lights are 'industrial white', they have a hum to them, or are just too dim. Not these! The app offers a TON of color options along with some pretty cool effect options. Through Amazon Alexa, you have limited options, but still MANY color choices. Plus, you can pick multiple whites. Cool, regular, soft, warm, etc. These aren't cheap, but are by far the best out there!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: The A19 Will NOT Connect!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 of these bulbs. One of them went offline for no reason. I have tried resetting the bulb and my wifi connection but it won't connect. In fact it won't even turn on. I have tried to contact LIFX support several times by email, but they NEVER responded, which is very frustrating. I tried to look for a phone number on the internet but they don't have any numbers listed either. It's like they already know about this issue and don't want to address it. Anyway, I am quite disappointed because these lights are expensive. If anyone knows their phone number, please share... Thank you
customer_reviews.author: DSLRPICTURES

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Bulbs, No Connectivity Issues
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! I got the Phips Hue but returned it because it was too dim, more so with certain colors. LIFX bulbs are brighter and more colorfful. I recommend also getting the Logitech POP so you have a wall switch for thw bulbs. It seems that the connectivity issues of before have been fixed with the the recent firmware updates. I've had no issues at all. It is recommended that you have very good router though. A lot of people that had issues had so-so routers. I have the Google Wifi mesh routers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Smart Bulbs!
customer_reviews.text: I prefer these bulbs over my Hue bulbs. They are easy to set up on your wifi and don't require a hub. They function the same way that Hue bulbs do but I don't need the extra piece of equipment sitting around ( hub ). They work seamlessly with my Amazon Alexa. I have the bulbs in my bedroom lamps and have them set up to gradually turn on 20 minutes prior to the time my alarm is set to go off. I generally wake up to a nice gentle light prior to the alarm ringing in my ear...a much more pleasant way to wake up in the morning!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly G

customer_reviews.title: Total Junk. Go with Hue
customer_reviews.text: I have both Hue and Lifx and these are total junk. BEWARE you have to save all packaging and printouts since these geniuses didn't print the home code on the bulbs. I had the installed and made the mistake of upgrading the firmware. It wiped out my HomeKit and Alexa integration. I didn't save the packaging so there is no way to recover the code to reconnect. The new app is junk. Save yourself the headache and stick with Hue.
customer_reviews.author: Sandmoose

customer_reviews.title: Using these to light up my room
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these to brighten up my room. They're working out very well and glad I I went with these 1100 lumen bulbs. The only problem is initially setting these up as the instructions for iOS are wrong when choosing the non-homekit method. Figured out that when you see the unconfigured bulb in iOS wifi and choose to setup new device to join wifi network and after bulb has connected to wifi do not continue nor close out that page in wifi setup wizard but immediately switch over to LIFX app in order for it to see the new bulb and register it to cloud. It was only way for the LIFX app to see new devices.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Martin

customer_reviews.title: Not the brightest
customer_reviews.text: Was excited to upgrade to a brighter Lifx bulb after the 75W A19 bulb burned out in about 1 year of normal use, but the excitement stopped there. It does everything it is suppose to do, but it just wasn't a noticeable difference from the 75W one. I suggest getting the 75W one to save a few bucks. Pros: - App support has still been updating and getting better - RGB - Dimmable - response time is pretty fast - Alexa integration supported - Works with IFTTT Cons: - Not as bright as you would expect
customer_reviews.author: Steven Chan

customer_reviews.title: Great product works really nice
customer_reviews.text: I have had a standard white light connected to Alexa for a while and it does great. I wanted to see if this was as good and I am delighted with the product. It took a little time to figure out getting it connected along with the other one (and 15 minutes) but after that it works fantastic. I can control both through Alexa separately, and really like the way they light the room. This is a truly great product that connects through the wi-fi without a separate hub. Great control, many light choices and so far very reliable. If the prices come down or I see good discount pricing I will light the whole house with them.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Mike

customer_reviews.title: 10/5 stars, it’s THAT good!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a color changing light before without acquiring knowledge, which was a huge mistake on my end. But THIS... this might be the only type of light I would ever recommend again. PERIOD. EXCLAMATION POINT! Worth every penny, bright af, accurate palette, the app is easy to navigate, the animations for the lights are fluid. The only gripe I have is with the music visualizer. It doesn’t work as well as I want it to, & idk why it never matches the tempo for me. But that’s no biggie. Perfect Light, WILL BE BUYING MORE SOON!!
customer_reviews.author: NikkoMPH

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: My daughter recently became a double amputee and getting this light for her room has been a Godsend. Then having all the other options to go with it made it even more fun for her. The only concern we had is that at first it would turn on for no apparent reason. Then we discovered there was a pre-set setting that caused this at like 3 am and then again 3 pm. So just look into the setting area if this occurs
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Cooper (Project life Transition)

customer_reviews.title: A great bulb let down by a terrible app.
customer_reviews.text: This bulb is a bit bulky but it's bright, looks wonderful, displays deep colors, and simply works as intended and as expected. It's true let down comes from the application it's teamed up with. When using the app for this light even from the beginning it was letting me down by taking way to long to connect. Aside from that issue, then app is buggy, boring, a bit tedious, and has a noticable lack in customization.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Could be WAY better
customer_reviews.text: Bought **25** of these for switching warm/cool colors in my house. Half the time 3-5 lights cant connect to the internet. So you end up with a pink light that your kid changed and you cant change color without resetting the light, or unscrewing it Setup is a PAIN for 25 lights. Alexa is even worse. Alexa misses more lights than the app. This product was meant to be just one light for a kids dorm room party, not a full house solution. All that said, its still better than Phillips Hue.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for kids!
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this light. This was a surprise Christmas present, and has really added a lot of extra personality to their rooms. The settings for standard lighting will let you shift a little toward red so reading at night is easier on the eyes. The bulb installs in a standard light socket and can be used in lamps. Electronic devices like a tablet or phone are necessary to use this, as it requires an app to run, whic was a little tricky to set up. We had trouble until we realized it requres access to device location (which I don't like). But the light works great and was well received.
customer_reviews.author: Heavy Skinz

customer_reviews.title: At first the bulb is great. Being able to switch to any color is ...
customer_reviews.text: At first the bulb is great. Being able to switch to any color is awesome and even more importantly, connecting to the bulb with HomeKit and not need a hub is perfect for me. However, after using for about a week, I notice that the bulb constantly has connection issues where I cannot control the bulb. Thing is, I know for a fact it isn’t the router since I’m on my Apple TV watching movies while surfing the web on my laptop. On top of that, users all over have reported the same issue across many forums so it is not just me. Because of this, I am now a Philips Hue owner and it just simply works.
customer_reviews.author: nathan

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Updated the firmware and now the bulb cannot maintain a WiFi connection it was annoying connecting when I first set this up months ago. But. At least it stayed connected. Then I made the mistake of downloading the LIFX app. Then updating the firmware. An hour afterwards I finally reconnected the idiot bulb to Apple home. I turned off the bulb from the Home app. And when I tried turning it on from the Home app, the bulb had disconnected. It is a very pathetic little device. So, the good news is that it’s bright when it works. It’s the “working” that’s the issue. It all comes down to what? Crappy programming?
customer_reviews.author: C. D. Zuff

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun but the wireless connection is still not rock solid
customer_reviews.text: These work, are convenient, very durable and fun. But the wireless sometimes just falls over and they get disconnected. The house has a mesh network 4 hotspots so I think that's good. I've noticed it sometimes fails updates then I have to re-provision it. Otherwise, decent. Pricewise, these are VERY EXPENSIVE. They need to adjust that because lots of competitors are 1/3 to 1/4 the price. I'll take a few less lumens and/or RGB colors for a lot lower prices.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beats Hue
customer_reviews.text: I have them all. Lifx is my favorite. It is more vivid than my phillips hue and brighter (for most colors...) And I am pleased by the new firmware. I have a V1, V2, V3 and this one and this one is the best. Tasker+AutoApps+IFTTT+Lifx=Amazesauce. Except version 3. Wow. I love you LIFX but that bulb is such a dumpster-fire. These new ones are great and getting better and better.
customer_reviews.author: Starfleet

customer_reviews.title: One year later -- and still doing it's thing
customer_reviews.text: I installed four of these bulb in a TV room back in November of 2017. Recently I had an issue due to a WiFi/Router upgrade, LIFX CS was right there helping me with connectivity issues only to find out the issue was not with the lights but with an overloaded smart house. Add a WiFi extender and the problem was fixed. One full year and these lights are passing the test of time.
customer_reviews.author: Columbia, MD

customer_reviews.title: will not stay connected to wifi have to reconnect every ...
customer_reviews.text: will not stay connected to wifi have to reconnect every day would not spend the money until these problems are fixed. If you want to spend your money for something that does not work and very little support the lifx build is the product for you. Have tried every update and reset procedures available but nothing works.
customer_reviews.author: Jjg147

customer_reviews.title: Drops wifi and never resets
customer_reviews.text: When working it's a great product. Deep rich colors, interesting and entertaining routines. Much brighter than the TPLink bulb used prior. Other than that this bulb is nothing but pain. The first and only time I had it working was the first week, ten days it was installed. Since then I have never been able to reconnect. I've used directions in the app, from the LIFX website, YouTube, tried a different lamp, tried a different home. Never will connect. I can take the TPLink bulb and be connected in less than five minutes. TL:DR Waste of time, waste of money, don't purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Todd T

customer_reviews.title: This Is a Must-Have Product If You Are Turning Your Home into a Smart Home
customer_reviews.text: I have bought three light bulbs already and I will continue to buy more when necessary. The customization options on these bulbs are endless, I have them connected to my voice assistant and they work flawlessly. In my opinion, these are much better than the Phelps hue bulbs because they are brighter at the maximum setting the ones manufactured by Phillips, with the added bonus of not needing the smart hub to handle them.; saving time and money. They help set the mood in a romantic situation or you can change the color to set a different ambience if necessary; overall this is a fantastic product.
customer_reviews.author: ICE

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THESE! The app is incredible and you don't need any hub devices, it just syncs to your WiFi and you're good to go. There's a calendar function so when you travel you can set them to turn on at night then off again, and you can control it from anywhere in the world. Absolutely LOVE this product, the light is extremely bright on the high setting, and nice and mellow and subtle on low but you can adjust to any range in between very easily. Can't wait to get more!
customer_reviews.author: DG57

customer_reviews.title: Controls your lights remotely! Pairs easily with Alexa.
customer_reviews.text: I love these lightbulbs. I have them all over the house, integrated with Alexa. It’s perfect when you’re out of the house and you want to control the lights with from the phone with the app. You can also set a schedule for them! I don’t use the different colors often but it’s great to know they’re there for entertainment. Brightness is easily adjustable to change the mood. On top of it, they really save on your energy bill! If my review has helped you in any way, please click the "helpful" button below so that I know! If you have any questions feel free to ask! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Could be good but too many problems since day 1.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this bulb for over a year and I want to like it, especially for the price. It constantly resets. I'll go to turn it on with my assistant and it tells me it's not available, so I turn the light off then back on and it's reset. I found an article saying that they come in demo mode sometimes so I got it out of demo mode, but it still reset just recently. I can tell you VeSync is way cheaper and works way better. Ironically a YouTuber I watch, said he had a ton of problems with his so he went with Hue.
customer_reviews.author: michael collins

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing Product and Support
customer_reviews.text: I have spent over the past 3 year’s probably, 200-300 hours connecting, claiming, reclaiming, etc., these bulbs. Purchased a special wi-fi modem and spent about $200. bucks with the Geeks to install and connect my 30 bulbs and strips. Once again, today there was some undetermined network issue which dropped off 15 of my lights off the network. I recommend doing your research before purchasing. You can’t count on LIFX Support, they post no live help. I sent in a trouble ticket 7 hours ago, and still nothing. I am going to check out their competition. I won’t buy anymore product.
customer_reviews.author: Ms M

customer_reviews.title: Died after a few months of use
customer_reviews.text: The light bulbs were fine while they actually worked, but after a few months they do not turn on anymore (essentially dead). I tried troubleshooting, by using the lifx main website but nothing worked. Kind of a waste of money for me since they did not last for nearly as long as they claim to last. LIFX claims they are rated for 40,000 hours (27 years at 4 hours per day) but I guess not...
customer_reviews.author: Jaydave Patel

customer_reviews.title: Nice WiFi Light, Great Brightness and Colors, Some Bugs
customer_reviews.text: This is a great light, the LIFX software is super nice, integration is ok, wifi connectivity is buggy. I had to follow all the directions to set my wifi environment to best use smart wifi systems. But reading reviews this is probably true for all smart wifi at this stage, and ditto the environment, so I don't knock that. One star for integration, tried Alexa, Google assistant on phone, Samsung smarthome on phone, nothing seemed better or more stable than LIFX app.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Burch

customer_reviews.title: Minimal support
customer_reviews.text: Light works, nice and bright, app works to control it, however control via Alexa is not working possibly because the update won't run....not sure. Tried all the suggestions to no avail. No phone support, no chat support. I have the A19 1100 lumen gen 3 version. Update: I now have it working with Alexa, Network set to b,g,n and firewall minimal protection. I had tried these things before, must have been all the stars aligned. No response from support, but at least it is now working!
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as expected after several times. It ...
customer_reviews.text: Does not work as expected after several times. It loss the bridge. Tried almost 5 times with TP Link or without it. The kasa app detects a different wifi and then it's unable to connect. It needs more QA. Update: For some reason l wanted to retry. I went again and reinstalled the application. It took three times to get it connected (More than an minute and third time it was successful. I still consider the product needs more quality assurance because the wifi it uses is still inconsistent.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina

customer_reviews.title: Such a good value
customer_reviews.text: I use this bulb in combination with their dawn + dusk app, and absolutely love it. I have a lot less issues waking up for an AM workout. I just always miss the sunset feature as I go to bed too late Haha. One of these days I'll work on that sleep deprivation... Btw - I love how cost competitive it is compared to Philips Hue. I wish it had the Sleep Cycle integration, or some integration with Fitbit, Oura, or other devices that have sleep cycles. But for the price, you can't beat this!
customer_reviews.author: Tanya

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: This bulb worked great for a while then stopped working with my WiFi. I reset it but then it never turned on again. It was really disappointing to have this issue on an expensive bulb that worked so great for such a short period of time.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime S.

customer_reviews.title: Average.
customer_reviews.text: Had a terrible time connecting with my dad's phone. Tried on my phone, did the same thing. Finally, got it to start connecting. It took well over 30 minutes for it to completely connect and function. Not as bright as I thought it would be. An average led bulb is far brighter. Shows full spectrum of colors on phone, but doesn't really show in the light bulb. Cool effects though and dimmable. Not the best color changing bulb out there.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: I had fun programming them to do different things with the IFTTT ...
customer_reviews.text: I've so far have bought 4 of theses lights. I was very excited about them and had planned to slowly replace most all my can lights with them. I had fun programming them to do different things with the IFTTT app but they have been nothing but problems and headaches!!! Tons of trouble getting my newest lights to connect. Now I'm having problems with my old ones too. For the price you pay for these they should work much smoother. I'm done with this brand and will be moving on to something else bc I still like the idea just not the product.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Stine

customer_reviews.title: Works very well without a hub. And a great value.
customer_reviews.text: These lights are so cool and worth the price. Unlike other brands you do not need to have a hub to connect them. These work out of the box with Apple's homekit but the Lifx app works much better. I use the Lifx app for changing the colors of the lights and homekit to turn the lights on when I get home at night. I have since bought the Lifx Z which is an LED strip and put it on the back of my tv. I highly recommend these smart light bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Larkins

customer_reviews.title: Pain to Setup
customer_reviews.text: Even with revised instructions, this is a big pain to setup. DO NOT INSTALL THIS BEFORE YOU GET IT ON YOUR WIFI! This is not compatible with HomeKit until you set this up on your network and use the LifX app to upgrade the firmware first. Don't be surprised if you have to reset the bulb to factory defaults a few times first. DO NOT THROW AWAY THE PAPERWORK! The HomeKit code is not printed on the bulb.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher W.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY— FAILS AFTER ONE YEAR, SOFTWARE DOES NOT WORK
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY LIFX PRODUCTS. I spent $800 on LIFX bulbs for my apt. It went great at first. One year later, they are all failing. The software is a disaster, it takes an hour of constant work to add each replacement bulb to the system. It’s horrible, expensive, and a massive waste of time. Go with a better brand, LIFX is a fly by night operation with great marketing, but their product is a DISASTER.
customer_reviews.author: gael p burke

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy LIFX!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy!! Ignore all reviews! The new app is a primitive, useless, kludge.
customer_reviews.author: Bob White

customer_reviews.title: WHAT A DISAPPOINTMENT
customer_reviews.text: ZERO STAR(s), as I type this, I'm going on Hour 3 trying to connect any of the LIFX apps to this heartbreaking LED. Inside both the Android, and IOS LIFX apps, the bulb goes through the (on-off) motions during setup, just never adds itself into the Dashboard of the LIFX app or Google Home Assistant App, even though these programs claim to see-communicate with the bulb. (argh) WHAT A DISAPPOINTMENT, as I didn't want to go the route of the Phillips with their hub nonsense, but guess where I'm headed next? To order that setup. Dang it all, I wanted this LIFX to work so so bad.... :-| Next stop, the Phillips setup (oh the pain)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Know your WiFi Signal Strength Before Purchasing
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup and functions as intended. However, if your WiFi network signal strength ever dips to below -60 dmb or lower, your light will desync and not function on your network. This light requires a very strong WiFi connection to function.
customer_reviews.author: Leinahtan

customer_reviews.title: This aspect is great. However the initial set up was a bit ...
customer_reviews.text: I chose this particular bulb because I could adjust it to a warmer white for my room. This aspect is great. However the initial set up was a bit harder than other smart bulbs I own. Also it is frustrating when paired with Amazon Echo. You have to ramble out a very particularly worded sentence to command on/off. "Alexa, tell Lifx to turn bedroom lamp on." Other products you just say "Alexa, turn bedroom lamp on." I am sure it sounds like nitpicking, but it gets frustrating when you have 5 products that work one way, and have to remember to do it a different way for just one.
customer_reviews.author: jenjen31

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't ask for a better product
customer_reviews.text: I got my first bulb over a year ago and have since bought 3 more. After doing the research I decided on these over the Philips line bc there's no hub and the price is way better. Not a single problem so far. Works great with Alexa and set-up couldn't be easier.
customer_reviews.author: That One Cat

customer_reviews.title: Great Product. Superior to the Philips Hue White and Colour Ambiance
customer_reviews.text: Works flawlessly with Apple HomeKit and Siri. An iPad, Apple TV or HomePod may be used as a hub for control of the light when away from your home (one you integrate your bulb with HomeKit). Brightness is amazing and the colours are nice and can set any mood and help you relax. The dimming is smooth. I haven’t had connectivity issues thus far and it didn’t slow my WiFi (disclaimer: I only use one bulb). Hue doesn’t support HomeKit without the hub, aren’t as bright, you don’t get the special effects that you do with this bulb and the list goes on. This is the one to get.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: love them, but a bit tricky to get set-up
customer_reviews.text: I have 20 LIFX bulbs in my house, all work flawlessly. I had a bit of an issue setting them up as my access point got near the max limit of devices so I had to move some of my devices to the 5GHZ band. Overall I am very pleased. I suggest taking a look at the wifi recommendations on the LIFX site. I had to often circumvent the normal set-up process and add the wifi network manually to the bulbs. Not sure why, but it felt like the process got stuck.
customer_reviews.author: iLovePrime

customer_reviews.title: Day dusk not so super
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy for dawn dusk feature if you ever expect to turn the bulb off. As soon as bulb goes off it stops updating color and brightness based on your time schedule. Its a known issue they have chosen not to fix. Its the entire reason i bought the bulb so now not any more useful than any other color changing led that is much cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: JSO

customer_reviews.title: Not ready for prime time.Dont buy.
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews hoping my experience would be better. Unfortunately, the light manages to not be accessible by the software on the app multiple times per day forcing you to reboot the light and setup procedure. I only bought 1 light thankfully. I can't imagine the nightmare of rebooting an entire house scene. When it works part of the time, it's quite good. They need to fix this problem instead of pumping out new products. I will reevaluate my rating if they can manage to listen to the customers experience.
customer_reviews.author: D. F.

customer_reviews.title: Give it time..
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this A19 bulb for 10 months. The first 9 months I couldn’t have been happier. Initial assessment: setup was a breeze, the light is very bright, very responsive to commands through Alexa. In the last month,however, The LIFX app changed at some point and then my light stopped responding 75% of the time through Alexa. So I’d go to the LIFX app to turn light off/on/change colors but the LIFX app wasn’t recognizing the bulb. Nothing on my end has changed. I’ve uninstalled and reinstalled the app. Unseated and reseated the bulb. Very frustrated with it now for the price I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: Cool party trick. That's it.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a tech geek and I really want to like these...but there are a few major issues with it. It is significantly larger than a standard bulb only because it's not round. 1. The square shape at the top makes it difficult to fit into certain lamps. 2. The app/software is terrible. Not intuitive. I've had this for months and gave up on trying to figure out how to set on schedule to turn off at a certain time. There is also no way for more than 1 person to have full administrative access to lights: only the main account owner can use the widget. 3. At $35/ea it's just not worth it. Cool party trick. That's it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Holmes

customer_reviews.title: These lights are great!
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 of these bulbs in my living room and they are a great product. I purchased the 1st one over 2 years ago. They are a little more money than a regular LED bulb but the regular one's can't change to any other color. Easy to set up, I use the Android app for them more than using my Amazon Alexa. The one I purchased in 2016 is starting to act up a little, anything more than 4000k and it is a slightly different shade from the other 2 I have
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: They are my first intelligent lights and I do not regret it. Buy two ampules A19, one for my room and one for the living area that faces the street. Its intensity was what convinced me against other brands, having 1100 lumens. The estotally friendly and intuitive App, and its technical support for frequently asked questions, gets you out of many doubts, such as: How to reset a light bulb to its factory state (this is when you change your home). Completely from another world these bulbs. Totally recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Nice but somethings to consider before choosing.....
customer_reviews.text: Using both LIFX and Philips HUE. Tough choice. I think the color on the LIFX is a little better and the app is much better. However, I have connection issues with the LIFX none with the Philips. Both nice products. If you have other lights that are NOT A-19 (e.g. E12) then Philips is the way to go. Hard to find LIFX in other sizes.
customer_reviews.author: vincent

customer_reviews.title: ... bought a bunch of these for the house and love them. They do not need a hub
customer_reviews.text: I've bought a bunch of these for the house and love them. They do not need a hub, have connected easily to my home wifi in minutes and work great with both the app and Google Home. Two things to be careful of, they are a little large so will not fit in smaller domed ceiling lamps. Also, when connecting new bulbs to Google Home, you need to unlink the lifx app from Google home after install and then re-link it for Google home to find the new light. These are super bright, dim well when needed and have a bazillion colors you can set them to. A much better setup than the Phillips Hue IMHO.
customer_reviews.author: v1c1ous1

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable.
customer_reviews.text: Review updated after a month of usage; 1 out of the 4 I bought has been giving me headache since day. It goes offline every few days. Restart or reset usually fixes the issue. However couple of days after the return window closed it completely died. Those bulbs are not reliable at all. I don't have experience with lifx support but I wish they I returned them before the window closed
customer_reviews.author: fedwa mustafa

customer_reviews.title: Bright smart bulb
customer_reviews.text: The bulb have a little weight it feels like well made, I love the package, is easy for me to set it up this was my first smart bulb I think it was easy I link it with alexa and it works really good, I love the app and all the features that it have. I will give and update 2 weeks later to see how it been working, but so far I have no issues with this light.
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: Is the best you can get. Period.
customer_reviews.text: THE GOOD: - Very Bright - App easy to use; - Easy to install - Great color accuracy THE BAD: - Is a little bit expensive I did a comparison with the Yeelight and the Philips Hue, and I think the results speak for themselves...
customer_reviews.author: David Hurt

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and then they just get better...
customer_reviews.text: Loooooooove these bulbs! They are amazing. I have 6 BR30s and a strip in my living room and then 4 BRs i+ 1 A19 n my bedroom. I can't tell you how cool it is to control these by the app and play with the settings... and just when you think that's amazing then you can connect them to Alexa...and an entire new level.. next I will be playing with the IFTTT settings... Super excited!!! I've gotten friends and family addicted to them! 😁
customer_reviews.author: Kim D.

customer_reviews.title: These are fantastic stand out from the others Ive tried and are ...
customer_reviews.text: Ive been playing with colorchanging LED's for 12 years now. These are fantastic stand out from the others Ive tried and are very bright for LED @ 11 Watts. Color is impressive and really saturates surrounding space. If a single lamp has multiple bulbs, can be tricky to synchronize the color changing. Installation works best when working with only one new light screwed in and paired to network at a time. Automated Dawn to dusk feature is a favorite in our house. If you want very bright and deep colors, and the feature of smart light control, these lights don't require an extra hub and are a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: Laam

customer_reviews.title: Brightest HomeKit Light
customer_reviews.text: I’m using these bulbs because of their HomeKit capability. They are the brightest HomeKit bulbs I’ve found at the moment - 1100 lumen (75W). I ordered a 4-pack of these bulbs, three of which installed and worked without problems. The fourth would setup with the LIFX App but would not connect to HomeKit. After following their troubleshooting guide, I contacted their Support. After 5 days of back and forth testing, they sent a replacement bulb. It installed and operates without problem.
customer_reviews.author: Henry C. Schmitt

customer_reviews.title: Buggy
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 LIFX lights, but this one stopped connecting to my WiFi after a few months. Despite following all the troubleshooting and wasting a couple of hours, I couldn’t get it to work properly and am left with a standard Led light, albeit one 5 times the cost. Also, these lights don’t work we’ll unless they are very close to a router. I have a very robust WiFi system and these lights get flaky when more than 25 feet away. Pretty lame
customer_reviews.author: Tony Bartelme

customer_reviews.title: Had potential
customer_reviews.text: Bought these with 6 minis. The minis were a hassle to set up but would eventually work, at least for 12 hours at a time. The A19s would never connect to the cloud. They would successfully connect to my wifi but would not connect to the lifx cloud. Support simply suggests that it must be my router, and I don't want to replace my unifi network just to have smart lightbulbs. Or even run different wifi hardware alongside my current hardware just to use Lifx bulbs. They're nice, but that doesn't really save money in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Very happy...
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this. I currently have it in my bedroom on my nightstand... I love all the ways in which you can adjust the lighting... Bright daylight for daytime, dim warm tones for night time, all adjustable from my phone. I have track lighting over my sewing area and I am looking forward to getting some for those!
customer_reviews.author: Zannie

customer_reviews.title: Cool colors!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty neat product that can really change the look & ‘feel’ of a room or outdoor loose of your home at night. The are various apps needing to be integrated for the remote control of the light — the LiFX app, Google Home, etc. that can be a little difficult to set the light up to work on several apps, but once that’s done, the product is easy to control. My light is used as an outdoor porch light, the app causes it to come on at dusk & turn off at sunrise, and I occasionally change the color to something other than white for various holidays.
customer_reviews.author: T Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Total garbage (unless you get directly from LIFX or other seller not selling garbage)
customer_reviews.text: These are garbage. I bought 4 from LIFX that work great. These don’t sync up with the WiFi and mess up the other 4 lights. Anytime I’d try to shut all the lights off with the app, they all start flashing. Yes I have them on a Lutron dimmer, but the other ones don’t mess up when these aren’t trying to pair. Of course I missed the return window. Don’t buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Love this bulb! What I did't understand from the beginning is they use the lower wireless bandwidth so initially I was ready to send it back, I took a deep breath and watched a utube video and my brain engaged. Love the different color and brightness, I cant say enough good things about it. Now to see how long it will last.
customer_reviews.author: ScottTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: one of 3 lightbulbs died after 2 month
customer_reviews.text: it's quite nice when it works. the reason I give 1 stars is because I had to move to new apartment and after 3 hours of struggle couldn't manage to connect bulb again though I followed instructions on their website and app. Also another bulb died on it's own after 2 month of use.
customer_reviews.author: Sergey

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with these light bulbs
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with these light bulbs. They keep disconnecting from the network and Alexa echo can not find them. This has happened four times with two bulbs in two weeks. I bought another brand by a major manufacturer and it has worked perfect. They also have terrible directions and the set up is so confusing since you have to use two apps and connect to your WiFi network. I thought they were a great buy until I had so many problems with the connection. The colors are nice and bright but I it takes 5-10 minutes to get them back connected. It’s not really worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Carolina ninja

customer_reviews.title: Great bulb, works as expected
customer_reviews.text: I have only had it installed for a few days at this point, but so far it is an excellent bulb. The setup was easy (using an iPhone), and connecting it to Alexa and Nest was quick and simple. As of this writing, I have not experienced any connectivity issues or other problems. Of note: The bulb I am reviewing is the whole room LIFX (A19). I purchased it while on sale for $39.99. Would I purchase the bulb again at $39.99? Yes. Would I purchase the bulb again at full price (currently $59.99)? Possibly, though I would think twice. While the product is great, the full price point is a little high. I might opt for the mini instead.
customer_reviews.author: DPL

customer_reviews.title: Died In Less Than 2 Years.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these $50 bulbs for my living room lamps on May of 2017. Just recently I noticed the light on one lamp had a greenish tint to it when it should be matching the light in the other lamp. I turned the light off and it didn’t come back on. Under two years for a bulb that’s supposed to last many years is unexceptionable.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: yes and no
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this light for how bright it is and all the color options were amazing! However I have a dimmer switch in the wall and it would not work with this light. Also I was not able to get it to stay connected to the wifi and I tried 3 networks and it would not stay connected so alexa did not work and I was not able to change colors or dim so I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Clinton L. Bieschke

customer_reviews.title: New Gadget
customer_reviews.text: Ordered from Amazon after reading reviews. A new gadget to try. Everything is as written, easy programming. Only disappointing to me is brightness, not as much as I like to see. Tried max. Best is can be operated with Alexa commands.
customer_reviews.author: S. Mamidi

customer_reviews.title: Quite Unfortunate
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if I had defective ones but all four have constant problems with connectivity, having to reboot them, not connecting to homekit, everything that could go wrong with them does. and it happens to all of them. I would NOT buy from them again. I have spent multiple frustrated hours trying to get them to communicate correctly and then at 2am when everything is working, one will become unresponsive and i have to start the whole process over again.
customer_reviews.author: Collin

customer_reviews.title: Colors are great! Very responsive.
customer_reviews.text: Colors on this are very good and there is a big range. I have three smart bulbs in my office and this one is the most responsive (as well as expensive) and i have yet to have an issue. Also it is very bright and the whites almost need to be toned down. I usually have it at around 60% brightness.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: A bit on the pricey side but so much fun!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my son in law and he loved it! Light was able to change at the strike of a button into a variety of colors! Light longevity is good...thank goodness given how expensive it was! The brightness was good given the ability of multiple colors! Packing was great with no damage to box or light.
customer_reviews.author: Brandee Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Great product, measure the harp first!
customer_reviews.text: Quite happy with the performance and ease of setup. It has very low latency for command reactions. There is one note to buyers. My experience, I used this in a table lamp with a shade. The harp holding the shade was 6" and the Lifx light did not fit. Replaced the harp with a 8" variety and no problems with the fit.

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work remotely close to as advertised. Application on Android and PC are riddled with bugs to the point of being completely unusable. Lighbulbs cannot update even after doing recommended troubleshooting. I would avoid this brand all together since the continued support is failing horribly. I will update this review if something magically changes before I return it this next weekend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smart Light Bulbs - They Work Great
customer_reviews.text: I like that this light is brighter than others and not only can you pick from a huge number of colors you can also pick from different whites, candlelight to bright white. The interface works well for me and I have programmed it to turn on to different colors as I get ready for work (green to get up, yellow its time to leave and red - I am late.) I also have a script to turn on my light when I come home. Occasionally one of my lights disconnects from my home router but it reconnects after a couple of minutes. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Stevenson.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bulbs with much improved reliability and setup.
customer_reviews.text: We now have 29 of these bulbs in our home. As their technology has improved over the years, they are now excellent all the way around. Reliable, so easy to set up. No connection issues as a result of several updates throughout 2018, early 2019. We love them and will be replacing every bulb in our home with these over time.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Lou W.

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: Lifx are the best smart bulbs. I absolutely adore them so much that I am getting them for my family now as well. My elderly grandfather loves he no longer has to get up to adjust the lights and that I have them set up to turn on automatically. When I set mine up every single light had to be reset and then set up again to go through the process fully, doesnt affect function but makes set up take a little longer.
customer_reviews.author: debraJ

customer_reviews.title: Poor WiFi connection.
customer_reviews.text: Returned to Amazon. This is a genius of a bulb. Bright and colorful. However, it fails to stay connected to the WiFi in my home. It was also very complicated to set up. It should be a simple plug in and pair it once operation. I should NOT have to use a separate WiFi router or enter codes to pair it. I tried all the solutions from their website but it was no help. Once they solve the connection issues I will consider purchasing this build again. But as is, it is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin D. Keepers

customer_reviews.title: Works for 6 months, then a hassle - AKA "It's gone dark."
customer_reviews.text: This light is cool and all, but after 6 months I am having to reset it once a day AT LEAST. "Reset" means power it on/off 5 times, then go to WiFi settings on phone, sync it to your WiFi (doesn't always work), go to the LIFX app, add it (doesn't always work). Then hopefully it adds it. If it doesn't, then you have to do it all over again. How much effort for a $40 light is needed? Oh yeah, it's $50 now too. It turns on but is just function as a normal, very expensive light now.
customer_reviews.author: luke

customer_reviews.title: These bulbs are pretty awesome. I love how i can control each ...
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs are pretty awesome. I love how i can control each bulb individually. Whenever i have a lot of work and have to pull an all nighter at my desk, the lights in our bedroom would be too bright and would disrupt my boyfriends sleep schedule, but with these, i can turn off all the lights except the one above my desk and can even control the brightness of the bulb. There's so many different color and setting options to choose from. The only thing keeping me from giving this 5 stars is that sometimes the one or two of the bulbs will lose connection.
customer_reviews.author: Alysia Huang

customer_reviews.title: ADDS A NEW DIMENSION TO HOME
customer_reviews.text: Ordered and received promptly, as described. Easy installation. Opportunity to change mood / atmosphere / color of room, or just light it up in the daylight of choice. I have now purchased 18 bulbs, some A19's and BR30's. They are connected to Google Home device easily for voice command, and used with IFTT app on phone to turn selected bulbs off when leaving for work and on when returning home.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen B

customer_reviews.title: Don't maintain connection very well
customer_reviews.text: Unlike my smart connected Wemo devices, these bulbs don't seem to maintain a constant connection, so when I try to voice control them, they suddenly aren't connected, and it takes 3-4 tries. I did some searching on this issue and seems to be a flaw in the wifi tech used in these. It's almost like they go to sleep and disconnect after a number of hours.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Von Pelt

customer_reviews.title: Great everyday bulbs, not just party lights!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing hues, but once the novelty wears off - still a great set of bulbs that turn on and off automatically. Can be controlled using schedules or with the Day and Dusk feature. Really love these in the living room - on before Dawn till lunch, off until Dusk until 11 - all auto and the warmth of a sunset (or whatever your preference. Easy setup as well and user-friendly app. Does require a smartphone and wifi.
customer_reviews.author: KareyS

customer_reviews.title: Bought two of these and the seemed to work fine for a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these and the seemed to work fine for a few weeks, then started having problems. The app keeps trying to do a firmware update which fails every time, and the lights WILL NOT stay connected, no matter what I try. Every time I reconnect them in the app things seem to function normally until I go away and come back a few hours later and sure enough, lights are offline. I'll update this if they start working again, but for the time being they're basically just very expensive regular light bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: gwhlives

customer_reviews.title: LIFX A19 LED Light That Needs No Stinking Hub!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the LIFX A19 LED lights as an open box product from Amazon and could not be happier. I installed the LIFX A19 LED lights outside on my carport and the front porch and set up the timer to turn the lights on at sunset and off at sunrise as I could not find flush mount ceiling dusk to dawn light fixtures or dusk to dawn bulbs that work properly inside light fixtures. The LIFX A19 LED lights should be fine being outside in sealed light fixtures.
customer_reviews.author: James M
